meanings.definition: To run or move quickly and without stopping.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was streeking across the savannah.
meanings.sent2: She was streeking to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The kids were streeking around the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent4: The car was streeking down the highway, leaving all other vehicles behind.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was streeking towards the finish line, determined to win the race.

meanings.definition: To mark with streaks or stripes.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally streeked paint on the wall while painting.
meanings.sent2: The artist was streeking vibrant colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The cat streeked the floor with muddy paw prints after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun streeked the sky with shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The storm streeked the landscape with lightning, illuminating the dark clouds.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden dash in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit streeked into its burrow when it sensed danger.
meanings.sent2: She streeked towards the finish line, determined to win the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel streeked up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The ball streeked past the goalie into the net, scoring a goal.
meanings.sent5: The child streeked towards the ice cream truck as soon as it arrived in the neighborhood.
